metadata.case_name: Jagdish Pandey v. Chancellor of the University of Bihar

facts.text: Appellant Jagdish Pandey joined as a lecturer in Ramakrishna College Madhubani in July 1948.
Appellant's appointment as lecturer approved by the University in June 1949.
Appellant confirmed as lecturer on September 23, 1951.
Post of Principal of Pandaul College fell vacant in July 1961 and was advertised.
Appellant applied and was appointed Principal of Pandaul College after interview on January 22, 1962.
Appellant's appointment as Principal approved by University on January 24, 1962.
Writ petition challenging appellant's appointment dismissed by Patna High Court on July 11, 1962.
Bihar State Universities (University of Bihar, Bhagalpur and Ranchi) Amendment Act, No. 13 of 1962 came into force on April 21, 1962.
Report of Joint Select Committee made on November 27, 1961.
Section 48-A came into force on March 1, 1962.

Chancellor approved appellant's appointment as Principal till November 30, 1962 or till candidate recommended by Commission joined, whichever earlier, on recommendation of Commission, dated August 18, 1962.

Similar order for another teacher of Ramakrishna College on May 31, 1962, challenged and struck down by Patna High Court on April 23, 1963 in Ram Kripalu Mishra v. University of Patna for violating natural justice.
Commission issued show cause notice to appellant on November 8, 1962 why Commission should not recommend to Chancellor to modify order of August 18, 1962.
Appellant replied to notice controverting all grounds.
Chancellor passed order on February 18, 1963 modifying August 18 order: appellant given year or two to obtain second class Masters degree, otherwise services terminated.
Appellant filed writ petition in Patna High Court challenging orders of August 18, 1962 and February 18, 1963.
Patna High Court dismissed writ petition on April 30, 1964, granted certificate.
Appellant had third class Masters degree, but confirmed before July 1, 1952; had 10 years teaching experience including 7 in degree college.

legal_issues.text: Whether Section 4 of the Bihar State Universities Amendment Act, No. 13 of 1962 is ultra vires Article 14 of the Constitution.
Whether orders dated August 18, 1962 and February 18, 1963 violated principles of natural justice and whether modification after expiry was valid.
Whether appellant deemed to have minimum qualification (second class Masters degree) under Chapter 16 Rule 1 sub-rule 6 of University Statutes for Principal post.

petitioner_arguments.text: Section 4 ultra vires Art.14 as dates arbitrary, no valid classification; confers uncanalised powers on Chancellor; no provision for hearing; no University approval unlike s.48A(6).
Order of August 18, 1962 violated natural justice (no hearing); could not be modified after November 30, 1962 as no review power; November 8 notice mala fide to cure defect.
Under Ch.16 r.1 sub-r.6, qualifications of teacher confirmed before July 1, 1952 deemed equivalent to minimum for post held; applies to Principal post as well.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Chapter 16 Rule 1 sub-rule 6 of University Statutes

respondent_arguments.text: Resisted writ petition; supported validity of s.4 and orders.

court_reasoning.text: Dates in s.4 not arbitrary; linked to Joint Committee report Nov 27,1961 and s.48A force March 1,1962; irregularities reported; valid classification with nexus.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Dates justified by circumstances to scrutinise appointments to avoid Commission scrutiny.

court_reasoning.text: S.4 read down: Chancellor power limited to scrutinise if appointments per University Act/Statutes etc. re qualifications/procedure; implicit hearing by Commission before recommendation.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No uncanalised power; not discriminatory; no need for University approval in this situation.

court_reasoning.text: August 18 order violated natural justice (no hearing); but notice/hearing given later; treat Feb 18 order as fresh under s.4; August order fell upon fresh proceedings.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Substance over form; natural justice complied in final order.

court_reasoning.text: Ch.16 r.1 sub-r.6 deems pre-July 1952 confirmed teachers' qualifications equivalent to minimum for 'the post he holds'; descriptive, applies to any post including promotion/Principal; protects for future appointments.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Third class MA deemed second class; no bar for higher post; High Court wrong in limiting to original post.

holdings.text: Section 4 valid under Art.14 when read down to permit scrutiny for compliance with University laws and implicit natural justice hearing by Commission.
Orders valid re natural justice as Feb 18 order fresh after hearing.
Appellant deemed to have second class MA under sub-r.6; qualified for Principal; Feb 18 order invalid.

precedents_cited.case_name: Ram Kripalu Mishra v. University of Patna
precedents_cited.relevance: Order struck down for violating natural justice without hearing; s.4 validity not decided.

statutes_cited.name: Bihar State Universities (University of Bihar, Bhagalpur and Ranchi) Amendment Act, No. 13 of 1962
statutes_cited.relevance: Subject appointments Nov 27,1961-Mar 1,1962 to Chancellor order on Commission recommendation; read down for scrutiny and natural justice.

statutes_cited.name: Bihar State Universities (University of Bihar, Bhagalpur and Ranchi) Act, No. 14 of 1960
statutes_cited.relevance: Establishes Commission; appointments on Commission recommendation post Mar 1,1962.

statutes_cited.name: Magadh University Act, 1961 (Bihar Act IV of 1962)
University Statutes
statutes_cited.relevance: Minimum qualifications for Principal: second class Masters + experience; sub-r.6 deems pre-1952 confirmed teachers equivalent.

outcome.summary: Appeal succeeds on interpretation of University Statutes sub-r.6; appellant deemed qualified; order of Feb 18,1963 quashed as invalid; s.4 upheld when read down.
outcome.relief_granted: Orders dated August 18, 1962 and February 18, 1963 liable to be quashed insofar as they affect appellant's appointment as Principal.

key_quotes.text: "s. 4 must be read down and if we read it down there is no reason to hold that the legislature was conferring a naked arbitrary power on the Chancellor."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Limits scope of s.4 to scrutiny for compliance with University laws.

key_quotes.text: "the words 'for the post he holds' are only descriptive and mean that if a person holds the post of a lecturer, his actual qualification will be considered to be equal to the minimum qualification of the lecturer if he happens to hold the post of a Principal, his actual qualification will be considered to be equal to the minimum qualification required for the post of the Principal"
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Interprets sub-r.6 deeming provision broadly for future promotions.
